Package lab2

Class Utilities

java.lang.Object
lab2.Utilities
public class Utilities extends Object
A random assortment of methods reviewing topics that should improve your programming skills in using Java Control Structures (selection structures, repetition structures, and nested Loops)

Use of arrays or any Java library class (e.g., array, ArrayList ) is strictly forbidden. Violation of this will result in a 70% penalty on your marks. Try to solve this problem using Java Control Structures (selection structures, repetition structures, and nested Loops) only

  • Method Details

    • sumofEvensandOdds

      public static String sumofEvensandOdds(int lowerLimit, int upperLimit)
      Write a static method that counts the number of integers between a lower-limit integer and an upper-limit integer. Also, the method computes the sum of all even and odd integers between the lower-limit and upper-limit input values.

      Use of arrays or any Java library class (e.g., array, ArrayList ) is strictly forbidden. Violation of this will result in a 70% penalty on your marks. Try to solve this problem using Java Control Structures (selection structures, repetition structures, and nested Loops) only

      Make sure the method compiles without errors and returns the correct result when invoked.

      Examples: 

       if lowerLimit=0 and  upperLimit= 5 then return "6 numbers between 0 and 5: sum of odds (9) and sum of evens (6)"
 if lowerLimit=10 and  upperLimit= 10 then return "1 number between 10 and 10: sum of odds (0) and sum of evens (10)"
 if lowerLimit=0 and  upperLimit= 6 then return "7 numbers between 0 and 6: sum of odds (9) and sum of evens (12)"
 if lowerLimit=7 and  upperLimit= 10 then return "4 numbers between 7 and 10: sum of odds (16) and sum of evens (18)"

      Remember that double quotations are shown above to indicate the beginning and end of the string value, and these double quotations are not part of the return value.

      Parameters:
      lowerLimit - lower limit integer value
      upperLimit - upper limit integer value
      Returns:
      String value as shown in the examples above

      Precondition: lowerLimit and upperLimit are non-negative values

    • minutesSeconds

      public static String minutesSeconds(int seconds)
      Write a static method receives a certain amount of time in seconds and then return a string indicated how many minutes and remaining seconds in the given input

      Examples: 

       if seconds=500 then return "500 seconds is (8) minutes and (20) seconds"
 if seconds=150 then return "150 seconds is (2) minutes and (30) seconds"
 if seconds=50 then return "50 seconds is (0) minutes and (50) seconds"

      Use of arrays or any Java library class (e.g., array, ArrayList ) is strictly forbidden. Violation of this will result in a 70% penalty on your marks. Try to solve this problem using Java Control Structures (selection structures, repetition structures, and nested Loops) only

      Make sure the method compiles without errors and returns the correct result when invoked.

      Remember that double quotations are shown above to indicate the beginning and end of the string value, and these double quotations are not part of the return value.

      Parameters:
      seconds - : int input value
      Returns:
      return the String value as shown in the examples above

      Precondition: seconds input value is greater than or equals to zero

    • fractionExponents

      public static double fractionExponents(int numerator, int denominator, int exponent)
      Write a static method to compute the exponent of a fraction number. The method receives numerator, denominator and exponents and then returns a double value representing the value of the given fraction raised to the given exponent. The returned value should be rounded to the nearest millionth

      Examples: 

       if numerator=1, denominator = 2  and  exponents= 2 then return 0.25
 if numerator=2, denominator = 1  and  exponents= -2 then return 0.25
 if numerator=25, denominator = 35  and  exponents= 3 then return 0.364431
      Make sure the method compiles without errors and returns the correct result when invoked.
      Parameters:
      numerator - integer value
      denominator - integer value
      exponent - integer value
      Returns:
      a double value representing the value of the given fraction raised to the given exponent. The returned value should be rounded to the nearest millionth

    • fiveyearbalance

      public static double fiveyearbalance(double balance, double interest)
      Write a static method takes in two numbers as input arguments: an account balance (rounded to two decimal points) and an annual interest rate expressed as a percentage. The method return double value indicated the balance after five years have elapsed. The return balance after five years should be rounded to two decimal points See examples below. Note that the interest from the first year is added back to the bank balance, therefore, itself subject to interest in the second year, and so on.

      Examples: 

       if balance=6000.00 and interest=4.25 then return  7388.08
 if balance=3000.00 and interest=3.50 then return 3563.06
 if balance=4000.00 and interest=2.25 then return 4470.71
      Make sure the method compiles without errors and returns the correct result when invoked.
      Parameters:
      balance - input balance
      interest - an annual interest rate expressed as a percentage. rounded to two decimal points
      Returns:
      double value as shown in the examples above
